conclusion: Analyze relative motion using v-t graph.
Pedestrian moves at constant speed; bus accelerates after green light.
Pedestrian's speed is constant at 8 m/s; bus starts accelerating at t = 8 seconds.
Distance covered by pedestrian before light turns green is 8t0.
Bus covers no distance before light turns green.
Additional distance covered by pedestrian after light turns green is 8(t - 8).
Total distance covered by pedestrian after light turns green is 8t0 + 8(t - 8).
Distance covered by bus after light turns green is (1/2)(t - 8)^2.
Equation for distance covered by bus becomes (1/2)(t - 8)^2.
For pedestrian to catch bus, quadratic must have real and non-negative solutions.
